com.burstly.lib.network.request
Class AbortableAsyncTask<T>

java.lang.Object
  android.os.AsyncTask<Void,Void,T>
      com.burstly.lib.util.PrioritizedAsyncTask<T>
          com.burstly.lib.network.request.SafeAsyncTask<T>
              com.burstly.lib.network.request.AbortableAsyncTask<T>
Type Parameters:
T -
All Implemented Interfaces:
IAbortableRequest
Direct Known Subclasses:
CurrencyRequestTask, SingleHostRequest, TrackDownloadRequest
public abstract class AbortableAsyncTask<T>
extends SafeAsyncTask<T>
implements IAbortableRequest

This class is a parent of all tasks. It has an ability to abort executing task but the specific logic must be implemented in children. Implementor MUST call parent onPostExecute(Object) in implementation classes.

getLevelTwoServers

protected List<String> getLevelTwoServers()

Returns:
List second tier servers

getSleepBetweenRequestCycles

protected long getSleepBetweenRequestCycles()
Return sleep interval for request cycles if no level one servers nor level two servers are available. After this interval full cycle will start again.

Returns:
long timeout in mills

convertServerResponse

protected abstract T convertServerResponse(String response)
Implement this method to provide specific conversion of server response. Parameter 'response' will never be null so you can omit null checks inside. This method is being executed in background thread.

Parameters:
response - String response from server
Returns:
T or null if there was an unchecked exception while converting request or null

isShouldUseSecondLevelServers

public boolean isShouldUseSecondLevelServers()
Should this request use second level servers from provider.

Returns:
boolean if true than request will use second level servers, false otherwise

setShouldUseSecondLevelServers

public void setShouldUseSecondLevelServers(boolean shouldUseSecondLevelServers)
Set to false to prevent request from using second level servers. True by default.

Parameters:
shouldUseSecondLevelServers - boolean false to disable usage of second level servers

isUseRequestCycle

public boolean isUseRequestCycle()
Should request cycle servers if none of them are available. True by default.

Returns:
boolean false if request will not use cycling of servers in case if none of them is available

setUseRequestCycle

public void setUseRequestCycle(boolean useRequestCycle)
Set false to prevent request cycling server hosts.

Parameters:
useRequestCycle - boolean
